Class Pile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pile

  • public class Pile
extends java.lang.Object
    Pile.java This class represents a pile of cards in solitaire. Unlike the deck, a pile does not necessarily contain 52 cards, it can hold anywhere from 0 to 52 cards. Piles can have cards added and removed at runtime. Note: the Pile class does not care how or in what order cards are added. The CardListener class is responsible for ensuring that cards are added to piles in red black red black order and that the faces are descending.
    Version:
    Mar 17, 2014
    Author:
    Jake Wilson

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAIN_PILE
      A main pile is one of the seven piles across the middle of the screen
      static int SUIT_PILE
      A suit pile is one of the four piles at the top right corner
      static int TEMP_PILE
      This indicates a pile that is being moved
      static int VERT_DISPL 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pile()
      No-arg constructor that sets the piles coordinates to (0,0) and sets the pile type to MAIN_PILE
      Pile(int x, int y, int t)
      Constructs a new pile of cards with an x location and a y location of (x,y)

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(int x,
               int y)
        Moves a TEMP_PILE. The method simply does nothing if the pile is not a TEMP_PILE. It also moves the x and y location of every card in the pile
        Parameters:
        x - the new x location of the pile
        y - the new y location of the pile
